results.title: Hayes Jones
results.creator_credit: Hugh King, Jerry Forman, Daniel Ruffini and Allegro Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
The story of New York’s new Commissioner of Recreation, a newly created post. Hayes Jones, former Olympic high hurdler, administers 900 parks, is activity director for eight million people and supervisor of 12,000 employees. We follow him through a typical working day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh King, Jerry Forman, Daniel Ruffini and Allegro Film Productions

results.title: Hawaii: the possible dream
results.creator_credit: E McGlone and Cate and McGlone Films
results.brief_description: A tourist eye-view of the islands comprising the Hawaiian chain. Beginning with the famed Waikiki Beach at Honolulu, on the island of Oahu, the varied tourist attractions are visited on Kauai - the Garden Island, Maui - the Valley Island and Hawaii - the Orchid Island, also famed for its extinct and erupting volcanoes.

results.title: Hawaii: the 50th state
results.brief_description: Describes the birth of the Hawaiian Islands and the creation of their spectacular land forms. Shows views of the still-active volcanoes on the island of Hawaii and the silent craters of Maui. Includes scenes of the city of Honolulu and of sugar and pineapple plantations.

results.title: Hawaii calls
results.creator_credit: T.W. Cate and Cate and McGlone Films
results.brief_description: Provides a good historical background and shows the great variety of scenery, fine hotels and Polynesian hospitality, together with the spirit of “Aloha” which make the Hawaiian Islands an ideal place for a holiday. Includes the many activities available to the tourists on the different islands - sports, night life, or just lazing in the sun.

results.title: Have a healthy baby
results.brief_description: Using animation, the film details the important stages of growth of the human embryo from conception to birth. There is major emphasis on the precise development of organ systems during the first three months. Ways that development may be disturbed, and the role played by good nutrition and health habits are also stressed.

results.title: Hausa village
results.creator_credit: Joan Duff, Central Office of Information and Taurus Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the Hausa people of northern Nigeria, a muslim people whose customs are often primitive, making a living from fishing and farming. The film is a survey of their communal life, their customs and culture, their ceremonies and traditions.

results.title: Hattie
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Suzanne Barker, Dept of Social Security and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
Hattie is seventy-six and completely alone, she has lost contact with a of her old friends and interests and feels that her life is now totally empty. Although she has always been happy and active, Hattie says she doesn’t care if she dies tomorrow, and that there are a lot of people like her, discarded because they are old. One of a series of films created originally for day- time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: The Hat
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Institute for International Peace and Storyboard
results.brief_description: An amusing treatment of the serious matter of World Peace and International Disputes. Two sentries are patrolling the border between hostile countries; one drops his hat and it falls across the line. When he tries to retrieve it war becomes imminent. Uses an interesting liquid form of animation. Dialogue and music are improvised by Dizzy Gillespie and Dudley Moore.
